description: Enterprise techniques used by Soft Cell, ATT&CK group G0093 v1.0
name: Soft Cell (G0093)

techniques.comment: Soft Cell used the Windows command shell to execute commands.
Soft Cell used a modified version of HTRAN to redirect connections between networks.
Soft Cell created rogue, high-privileged domain user accounts to maintain access across waves of a compromise.
Soft Cell used a modified version of Mimikatz along with a PowerShell-based Mimikatz to dump credentials on the victim machines.
Soft Cell used reg commands to dump specific hives from the Windows Registry, such as the SAM hive, and obtain password hashes.
Soft Cell used winrar to compress and encrypt stolen data prior to exfiltration.
Soft Cell used winrar to compress and encrypt stolen data prior to exfiltration.
Soft Cell collected data from the victim's local system, including password hashes from the SAM hive in the Registry.
Soft Cell compressed and staged files in multi-part archives in the Recycle Bin prior to exfiltration.
Soft Cell used DLL side-loading to covertly load PoisonIvy into memory on the victim machine.
Soft Cell used Web shells and HTRAN for C2 as well as to exfiltrate data.
Soft Cell exploited a publicly-facing server to gain access to the network.
Soft Cell established VPN access into victim environments.
Soft Cell ensured each payload had a unique hash, including by using different types of packers.
Soft Cell used a renamed cmd.exe file to evade detection.
Soft Cell used a modified version of HTRAN in which they obfuscated strings such as debug messages in an apparent attempt to evade detection.
Soft Cell used dumped hashes to authenticate to other machines via pass the hash.
Soft Cell used PowerShell for execution to assist in lateral movement as well as for dumping credentials stored on compromised machines.
Soft Cell dropped additional tools to victims during their operation, including portqry.exe, a renamed cmd.exe file, winrar, and HTRAN.
Soft Cell used a modified version of nbtscan to identify available NetBIOS name servers over the network as well as ping to identify remote systems.
Soft Cell established persistence for PoisonIvy by created a scheduled task.
Soft Cell packed some payloads using different types of packers, both known and custom.
Soft Cell used ipconfig /all to obtain information about the victim network configuration. The group also ran a modified version of nbtscan to identify available NetBIOS name servers.
Soft Cell used netstat -oan to obtain information about the victim network connections.
Soft Cell used whoami and query user to obtain information about the victim user.
Soft Cell leveraged valid accounts to maintain access to a victim network.
Soft Cell used Web shells to persist in victim environments and assist in execution and exfiltration.
Soft Cell used WMI for execution to assist in lateral movement as well as for installing tools across multiple assets.
